title: libert19
author: libert19
content: They have different 'minimum amounts' for different pairs. If ever feel stuck and feel like you are below minimum then try different pairs. Tron, hive and similar low transaction fee blockchain work best, thereon convert to coin/token you came to exchange.

comments.author: kensaii
comments.body: You're right, Tron usually has the lowest minimum and fee of all exchanges for you to switch and transfer out your little assets. I remember LTC use to be a good alternative for low minimum amounts too. Then also Doge too before it becomes a high price meme coin like today.

comments.author: LoyceMobile
comments.body: That's a good moment to try Bitcoin LN: on my favorite instant exchange the minimum amount on LN is much lower than on-chain.

comments.author: mk4
comments.body: That is, if you want your funds to be on the Tron blockchain or any other smart-contract blockchain in general in the first place lol. Really, there nothing much to do on most blockchains outside of Ethereum and Solana; so it's either Ethereum, Solana, or good 'ol bitcoin for me.If we're talking about CEX withdrawals and Solana is not accepted for withdrawals, then I just leave the dust on the exchange until I make another deposit.

comments.author: Johnyz
comments.body: Quote from: libert19 on August 03, 2022, 09:44:32 AMThey have different 'minimum amounts' for different pairs. If ever feel stuck and feel like you are below minimum then try different pairs. Tron, hive and similar low transaction fee blockchain work best, thereon convert to coin/token you came to exchange. TRON is really a good option and with a lower minimum plus their fees are not that big compare to other coins.If you are just on that exchange to trade your tokens, this can be your best option but I suggest not to stay on a smaller site longer because for me its not safe and its always good to use the top exchanges but don't ever put big money on any exchanges.

comments.author: RILWAN
comments.body: In my early days in trading i used to be stuck with this problem ,where my balance in not enough to carry out the trade, and instead of looking for a lower tier I will just stick it that way. But now that am well informed I don't commit such error any more

comments.author: TimeTeller
comments.body: Quote from: RILWAN on August 03, 2022, 10:31:23 PMIn my early days in trading i used to be stuck with this problem ,where my balance in not enough to carry out the trade, and instead of looking for a lower tier I will just stick it that way. But now that am well informed I don't commit such error any more I believe, this will be one of the learnings that a crypto trader will acquire at the beginning.At some point, we will understand that each exchange has their own minimum amount of trades.Just like for example, binance, most trading pairs, you can execute at the min of 10USD equivalent.So if your coins are below in that amount, you can't trade and need to add more if you want to complete your order.

comments.body: Quote from: mk4 on August 03, 2022, 06:29:26 PMThat is, if you want your funds to be on the Tron blockchain or any other smart-contract blockchain in general in the first place lol. No, you then convert from that cheaper coin to coin you came to exchange in first place. Yesterday, wanted to convert 1 dot to hive. For this pair, minimum was 1.4 dot, so first converted 1 dot to tron (this pair had 0.6 dot minimum) and then tron to hive. Hope it's not confusing.
